Signal intermediate catch event
The "Signal intermediate catch event" element is a
signal receiver
and processes events received from the
source
. Its execution is blocked until the corresponding signal is received, ensuring thread synchronization.
The signal handler in the system is implemented by the
"WorkFlow. Event handler. Signal"
type.
In the business process diagram, the signal handler is represented by
.
Signal processing can be configured both within elements of the same business process as well as across different business processes (subprocesses).
To configure the signal parameters, save the business process diagram, then click the
button in the stage menu: a modal window with the set of parameters for configuration will open.
Setting
Purpose
"Signal settings" tab
Object state
Selecting the object state from the System directory.
Acts within a process instance
Boolean parameter that restricts signal distribution outside the process instance:
when the switch is active, signal handling occurs within the diagram (the source and receiver must be in the same business process diagram);
when the switch is inactive, signal handling occurs in multiple diagrams (source and receiver can be in different business processes).
Signal
Defining the relation with the
source
for signal transmission configuration.
The source and signal handler are matched according to the value specified in the "Signal" field. If no values are provided in this field,
the element names in the diagram must be identical
.
It applies to parallel running BPs on other route objects
Boolean parameter that determines the distribution of the signal to parallel running business processes on other route objects.
Algorithm to define an object
Selecting
algorithm
to define the object that will receive the signal.
If no algorithm is specified, the signal handler will search for all objects with active processes.
Expect processing of all signals
Boolean parameter that controls waiting for signal processing:
when the switch is active, the receiver waits for all signals from the source before continuing the process;
when the switch is inactive, the receiver waits for the first signal from the related source to continue the process.
Rollback route by timeout
Boolean parameter that triggers the automatic rollback of the process route if the expected source signal is not received within the specified time:
when the switch is active, the handler waits for the signal for the duration specified in the "Timeout before rollback (sec)" parameter;
If the signal is not received within the specified time, the business process will roll back to the stage specified in the "Rollback to scheme element" parameter.
when the switch is inactive, the handler waits for the signal without a time limit.
Route rollback timeout in seconds
Time to wait for the signal (in seconds).
By default, the value 300 is used.
This parameter is available when the "Rollback route by timeout" switch is active.
Rollback process item
Selecting the business process stage where the route will be rolled back after the specified time.
This parameter is available when the "Rollback route by timeout" switch is active.
